title: People Line Up to See and Smell Rare, Stinky 'Corpse Flower' in Australia
text:
Up Next
People Line Up to See and Smell Rare, Stinky 'Corpse Flower'
January 23, 2025
The Botanic Gardens in Sydney, Australia featured this flower. Scientifically it's named the Giant Amorphophallus Titanum, but nicknamed Putricia by the locals for its foul stench. It only lasted for about 24 hours, so anybody curious about the odor had to queue up to experience it for themselves. Inside Edition Digitalâ€™s Mara Montalbano has more.
